Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

LocationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

LocationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

LocationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Data.description: Reference to an existing Inventory Site.  Assigns the Site for the transaction and derives the Company.

Inventory_ReturnObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Inventory_ReturnObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Inventory_ReturnObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Data.description: Reference to an existing Inventory Return Order.  The status of the return order must be Approved and the return order must be for a Transfer Stock Request whose Transfer To Site matches the adjusting Inventory Site.

validation.validation: The number of return lines submitted for an adjustment must equal the number of open lines on the order.  Either too many lines have been provided or not enough.

Inventory_Return_LineObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Inventory_Return_LineObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
For types that require a parent reference, contains a unique identifier for an instance of a parent object.
For types that require a parent reference, the unique identifier type of a parent object.

Inventory_Return_LineObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Detail_.description: References the return order line for which quantity is being adjusted.

validation.validation: Return Order Line [line] does not have a status of Open.
The referenced return order line [line] does not belong to the inventory return order.

Inventory_Location_EnabledObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Inventory_Location_EnabledObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Inventory_Location_EnabledObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Detail_.description: References the stocking location where quantity is being adjusted.

validation.validation: Location [loc] is currently on hold.
Invalid storage location referenced for [purchase item] [uom] [lot] in location [location].  Either a put away has not yet occurred or the entered data is invalid.
The Stocking Location must belong to the Inventory Site specified in the header.
validation.description: The Stocking Location must belong to the Inventory Site specified in the header.

validation.validation: The total Quantity to Adjust across multiple return adjustment lines from Location [location] for Item [item], Unit of Measure [uom] [lot] exceeds the quantity available in the location.

The Quantity to Adjust (decrease) is greater than the quantity available to be adjusted. Please correct the Quantity to Adjust so the resulting quantity on hand is greater than or equal to the quantity which is currently picked/allocated in the location.
validation.description: The Quantity to Adjust (decrease) is greater than the quantity available to be adjusted. Please correct the Quantity to Adjust so the resulting quantity on hand is greater than or equal to the quantity which is currently picked/allocated in the location.

Purchase_ItemObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Purchase_ItemObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Purchase_ItemObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Detail_.description: References the inventory item for which quantity is being adjusted for a return.  Providing the inventory item is optional.  If provided it must match the item on the return line.  If not provided the item on the return line will be auto-filled.

validation.validation: The provided inventory item [item] does not match the item on the return order line.

Unit_of_MeasureObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Unit_of_MeasureObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Unit_of_MeasureObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Detail_.description: References the Stocking Unit of Measure for the Adjustment for Returns.  Providing the unit of measure is optional.  If provided it must match the unit of measure on the return line.  If not provided the unit of measure on the return line will be auto-filled.

validation.validation: The provided unit of measure [uom] does not match the unit of measure on the return order line.

Item_LotObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Item_LotObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Item_LotObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Detail_.description: References the lot ID for the item which is being adjusted for a return. Providing the lot is optional. If provided it must match the lot on the return line. If not provided the lot on the return line will be auto-filled.

validation.validation: The provided item lot does not match the lot on the return order line.
A lot id can't be assigned to an item which is not lot-controlled.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Detail_.description: References the Quantity to Adjust for the return line.  Providing the quantity is optional.  If provided it must be the negated quantity on the return line.  If not provided the Quantity to Adjust will be auto-derived.

validation.validation: The provided quantity [quantity] does not match the quantity on the inventory return line.

Item_SerialObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Item_SerialObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Item_SerialObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Detail_.description: References the Item Serials for the Inventory Item

validation.validation: Serial Numbers do not belong to the item
The count of serial numbers entered does not match the quantity.
Serial number(s) [number] currently exists on another picking list.
This set of serial number(s) ([itemserials]) is not located at [location] [lot] for [item]. Please check the serial number(s) on [item].
One or more Serial Numbers do do not belong to the return order.
validation.description: One or more Serial Numbers do do not belong to the return order.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Detail_.description: Memo for the Inventory Adjustment detail line.

Inventory_Adjustment_for_Returns_Data.description: Encapsulating element containing Inventory Adjustment detail data.

validation.validation: The total adjustment quantity across multiple return lines for Item [item] can’t be adjusted. The total ([qty to adjust] [base uom]) is greater than the quantity available to reserve ([adjustable qty] [base uom]).  Unreserve [difference] [base uom] to allow this adjustment.
Serial number isn't allowed for non-serial controlled item.
Duplicate adjustment rows found for the same return line.  Please remove the duplicate(s).
